intro: Hedysarum obscurum var. connatum, commonly known as the dark hedysarum, is a perennial leguminous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
